title: The year of the music licensing legal wars
excerpt: When the Supreme Court decided against Grokster in 2004, it changed the internet forever.

title: The Case for and Against Ed Sheeran
excerpt: The pop singer’s trial for copyright infringement of Marvin Gaye and Ed Townsend’s “Let’s Get It On” highlights how hard it is to draw the property lines of pop.

title: Metadata is the biggest little problem plaguing the music industry
excerpt: It’s a crisis that has left, by some estimations, billions on the table unpaid to musicians

title: Why Don’t Some TV Shows Sound the Way They Used To? (Published 2021)
excerpt: Licensing issues have gutted the soundtracks of many beloved series on streaming services, resulting in bewildering music cues and missing theme songs.

title: Mass Hipgnosis | Rich Woodall
excerpt: In an industry already powered by the repackaging of past hits, music funds like Hipgnosis want every tomorrow to sound more and more like yesterday.
